title: 79/16. Establishment of a nuclear-weapon-free zone in the region of the Middle East

paragraphs.1: Urges all parties directly concerned to seriously consider taking the practical and urgent steps required for the implementation of the proposal to establish a nuclear-weapon-free zone in the region of the Middle East in accordance with the relevant resolutions of the General Assembly, and, as a means of promoting this objective, invites the countries concerned to adhere to the Treaty on the Non- Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons;3
paragraphs.2: Calls upon all countries of the region that have not yet done so, pending the establishment of the zone, to agree to place all their nuclear activities under International Atomic Energy Agency safeguards;
paragraphs.3: Takes note of resolution GC(68)/RES/14, adopted on 19 September 2024 by the General Conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency at its sixty- eighth regular session, concerning the application of Agency safeguards in the Middle East;
paragraphs.4: Notes the importance of the ongoing bilateral Middle East peace negotiations and the activities of the multilateral Working Group on Arms Control and Regional Security in promoting mutual confidence and security in the Middle East, including the establishment of a nuclear-weapon-free zone;
paragraphs.5: Invites all countries of the region, pending the establishment of a nuclear- weapon-free zone in the region of the Middle East, to declare their support for establishing such a zone, consistent with paragraph 63 (d) of the Final Document of the Tenth Special Session of the General Assembly, and to deposit those declarations with the Security Council;
paragraphs.6: Also invites those countries, pending the establishment of the zone, not to develop, produce, test or otherwise acquire nuclear weapons or permit the stationing on their territories, or territories under their control, of nuclear weapons or nuclear explosive devices;
paragraphs.7: Invites the nuclear-weapon States and all other States to render their assistance in the establishment of the zone and at the same time to refrain from any action that runs counter to both the letter and the spirit of the present resolution;
paragraphs.8: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the implementation of resolution 78/17;
paragraphs.9: Invites all parties to consider the appropriate means that may contribute towards the goal of general and complete disarmament and the establishment of a zone free of weapons of mass destruction in the region of the Middle East;
paragraphs.10: Requests the Secretary-General to continue to pursue consultations with the States of the region and other concerned States, in accordance with paragraph 7 of resolution 46/30 and taking into account the evolving situation in the region, and to seek from those States their views on the measures outlined in chapters III and IV of the study annexed to the report of the Secretary-General of 10 October 19904 or other relevant measures, in order to move towards the establishment of a nuclear- weapon-free zone in the region of the Middle East;
paragraphs.11: Also requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its eightieth session a report on the implementation of the present resolution;
paragraphs.12: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session the item entitled “Establishment of a nuclear-weapon-free zone in the region of the Middle East”.
